metadata.title: Suspected Drone Explodes Near Osiny in Eastern Poland

left: An unidentified flying object crashed into a cornfield and exploded in eastern Poland, as reported by the country’s news agency PAP.
Damage included broken windows in some houses, but no injuries were reported, according to PAP.
Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz stated that the object was likely a drone and analysis is ongoing.
Investigators, both civilian and military, are examining the crash site near the village of Osiny, where debris was found.
center: An unidentified flying object crashed into a cornfield and exploded in eastern Poland, as reported by the country’s news agency PAP.
Damage included broken windows in some houses, but no injuries were reported, according to PAP.
Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz stated that the object was likely a drone and analysis is ongoing.
Investigators, both civilian and military, are examining the crash site near the village of Osiny, where debris was found.
right: An unidentified object fell into a cornfield and exploded overnight in the village of Osiny in eastern Poland's Lublin province, according to police.
Local media reports suggest the object was likely a Russia Shahed loitering drone, often used to bombard Ukrainian cities.
CCTV footage captured the moment of the explosion in the small village in eastern Poland.
Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz stated that an analysis is underway to determine whether it was a military or smuggling drone.
